intro: Blighiopsis pseudostipularis, commonly known as the slender-stipule blighia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, ovate leaves with short stipules. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and numerous stamens. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds, often dispersed by animals or wind.
